page.title: 01Loch Trool
page.content: Loch Trool extends for 3km up the Glen of Trool. It is surrounded by hills, mainly forested by coniferous plantations. Loch Trool is owned by Lord Grantchester, who has a residence, Glen Trool Lodge, on the north shore. On the NE shore of Loch Trool, where it enters the Waters of Trool is a large Forestry Commission campsite 'Caldons', popular with walkers. A Forest Trail around the Loch and a Forest Trail to the south have been waymarked. The ascent of 'Merrick' - at 843m, the highest peak in the Southern Uplands - begins near Buchan Farm. A memorial 'Bruce's Stone' by the road between Glen Trool Lodge and Buchan records the ambush of an English army on the southern shore opposite, by Robert the Bruce in 1307.
